intro: Scelochilopsis, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Plumbagaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their striking blue or violet flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. Scelochilopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments. Their botanical features make them unique examples of coastal flora.
